title: Valid Parentheses
algorithmDescription: Check if string has valid matching parentheses using stack
detailedDescription: Determine if input string has valid parentheses. Valid means every opening bracket has corresponding closing bracket in correct order. Support (), {}, []. Input: A string containing brackets. Output: 'valid' or 'invalid'. Example: '({[]})' is valid, '([)]' is invalid.
hints: Use stack to track opening brackets
On closing bracket, check if it matches stack top
String is valid if stack is empty at end
commonMistakes: Not checking stack emptiness at end
solutionApproach: Iterate through string. Push opening brackets to stack. On closing bracket, pop stack and verify it matches. After iteration, check if stack is empty.
testCaseCriteria: Must correctly validate various bracket combinations including nested, multiple types, and invalid sequences.
